blog.name: avatarmovies
blog.title: James Cameron's Avatar
blog.description: Unofficial fanpage for James Cameron's "Avatar" films. We are in no way associated with James Cameron, Jon Landeau, or any of their affiliates. No images or videos belong to us unless otherwise stated.

summary: Box Office: 'Avengers: Endgame' Probably Won't Top 'Avatar,' And That's Good For Disney
title: Box Office: 'Avengers: Endgame' Probably Won't Top 'Avatar,' And That's Good For Disney
excerpt: Whether the biggest movie is 'Avengers: Endgame,' 'Avatar' or 'Star Wars: The Force Awakens,' that's still a win for the Mouse House.

summary: ‘Avengers’ Forced to Drop Black Widow-Hulk Romance Because There Was Just Too Much Plot
body:
‘Avengers’ Forced to Drop Black Widow-Hulk Romance Because There Was Just Too Much Plot

So, they actually wrote and shot Brutasha scenes! Those sideways glances in IW and Endgame were canon and intentional on the part of everyone involved even if the dialogue about them didn’t make it in.

blog.title: A tribute to America’s favorite ass
blog.description: Kelsey || she/her/hers || chris evans fan first, human second || follow americasass1945 on ig for quality ass content

summary: Are you sad about Tony Stark’s death? Don’t be! He doesn’t die until 2023. We have him for four and a half more years. Celebrate...
body: Are you sad about Tony Stark’s death? Don’t be! He doesn’t die until 2023. We have him for four and a half more years. Celebrate him now and then we can mourn in 2023 when that fateful day comes. Thank you for coming to my TED talk.

summary: love language. Prompt:  Can you please write a Natasha Romanoff x reader one shot? I’ll take any situation but a preferably...
body:
love language.

Prompt: 

Can you please write a Natasha Romanoff x reader one shot? I’ll take any situation but a preferably something with a lot of fluff or something steamy❤️

Request: yes | no by this lovely anon

Paring: Natasha x reader, Natasha x platonic!Wanda

Warning: none? 

Word count: 1.3k

I don’t know if this is what you were initially looking for but i hope you like how it turned out!!💕ps. you didn’t specify the gender so i tried my best to make it as gender neutral as possible :)) - Lix


Natalia Alianovna Romanov is many things. The Black Widow, former Russian super spy, top SHIELD agent, etc. But of all the titles she’s been given, nothing sounded better when she’s introduced as Y/N’s girlfriend.

So, why is she awake at 4 am, sitting on the kitchen counter at the Avengers compound, contemplating about her relationship with them? She truly doesn’t know. It’s not that she doesn’t love her partner, no it’s not that at all, it’s just, she’s never said it. Well, at least not when her lover is awake anyway. She lost count on just how many nights she’s spent looking at the love of her life snoring lightly on her pillow, while she whispers the words “I love you” over and over again.

She let out a sigh as she looked down at the mug in her hand, the coffee was long gone, leaving a light stain where it used to be filled. She hopped off the counter carefully and made a beeline to the coffee maker, deciding that sleep is useless by this point. As she was filling up the pot with water, she heard light footsteps approaching the kitchen. She turned to look over her shoulder and was surprised to see the little witch padding her way in with tousled hair and an oversized t-shirt.

“Early morning?” She asked gently with a raised brow, which only earned her a chuckle in return.

“I could say the same to you.” The witch smiled. “Are you making coffee at 4 am in the morning?”

“Um, yeah. I couldn’t sleep so might as well. Want one?”

Wanda shook her head and settled down on one of the stools.

“It’s alright, thank you though.”

They didn’t speak much after that, both preoccupied with whatever was keeping them up at night until the sound of the coffee maker brought them back to reality. Natasha poured herself a cup and settled down next to Wanda, enjoying the company of the little witch.

“Penny for your thoughts?” She asked the young witch.

“I’m thinking about Pietro.” Natasha frowned at the mention of the twin, she knew how much he meant to Wanda and it pains her to see the little witch in sorrow.

“What about him?”

“Not about him really, more so, whether or not he’d be proud of how far I came. How far we all came.”

Natasha smiled and looked back at the witch.

“He is Wanda. All of us are.”

The grin on the girl’s face was beautiful, and Natasha thinks that Vision is truly a lucky one.

“What about you?” The girl asked after a while. “What kept you up at night?”

“Couldn’t you just read my mind?” She teased.

Natasha knew she could’ve easily read her mind if she really wanted to, but after their first encounter, she knows that the little witch would never do it again unless she tells her to.

“I could, but where’s the fun in that?” The witch teased back and Natasha laughed.

“You’re not wrong there, little witch.”

“So? What’s up?”

Natasha didn’t answer her. She simply just stared down at her coffee mug, not knowing how to explain what’s bothering her.

“It’s about Y/N.” It was more of a statement than a question.

Natasha sighed and nodded her head, knowing there’s no use in lying to Wanda.

“Did something happened?” Wanda asked, suddenly concerned.

“No.”

“Then what is it?”

“I… I don’t know how to tell her I love her,” Natasha muttered out, a light blush flushed over her pale cheeks.

Wanda only smiled at her warmly, knowing full well how hard it is for the former assassin to love someone, let alone admit it out loud.

“Why are you so fixated on telling her you love her?” She asked the woman gently.

“We’ve been together since before Thanos happened, and I never once told her I love you. And I guess I just, I want something normal for once. I want to be able to tell her I love you. But those words just, never seem to be able to come out.”

Wanda placed a hand on Natasha’s shoulder, silently comforting the overthinking redhead. They stayed like that for a while until the sun started peaking through the window.

“We’re the Avengers, Nat. We strayed from normal long ago.” The witch said mindlessly.

Natasha sighed, because she knows that. She knows they’ve lost the chance to be normal long ago, especially Wanda and herself. But that doesn’t mean she doesn’t wish for it.

“Sometimes,” she spoke gently, “nothing needs to be said in order for someone to understand it. Vision’s not quite human, so he never really knows how to feel. But I know he loves me. I can feel it when he always makes time for me. When he always knows when to give me space and when to keep me company. He’s always there to make sure that I never feel alone, and although he never said I love you, I know he does.”

“And it doesn’t upset you? That he never said it?”

The girl only smiled as she turned and stare down the hallway.

“It used to. But, I love him. So I’m willing to learn how to speak his love language when he isn’t able to speak mine.”

Natasha looked over at the witch and smiled softly, she understands what Wanda was trying to tell her and she’s grateful for it.

“Thank you.” She said as she turned to pull Wanda into a hug.

The girl smiled and returned the embrace, knowing that the redhead had gotten her message.

As Wanda got up and left, Natasha called out for her before she reached the hallway.

“Hey, Wanda?” She called out.

The witch hummed in reply as she turned slightly to look at the redhead.

Natasha was thoughtful for a moment before she decided to just keep her words casual and not sentimental.

“It’s nothing, just… glad you’re here is all.”

The witch smiled widely and replied warmly.

“I love you, too.”

Natasha only laughed as she shook her head, Wanda really is something else.

It was about an hour later when Y/N strolled in the kitchen, looking adorably sleepy as they walked up to Natasha and wrapped their arms around her neck.

“You weren’t in bed.” Y/N said through a pout.

Natasha let out a soft giggle as she planted a kiss on her lover’s head.

“Sorry love, I couldn’t sleep.”

“Is everything alright?”

The worried look in Y/N’s eyes filled Natasha’s heart with fondness and warmth that she’s never thought that she’d be able to feel.

“Everything’s great love, promise.”

“Then come back to bed with me” Her lover whined and Natasha simply shook her head, the smile still on her face.

She left a kiss on Y/N’s cheek and laced their fingers together, pulling her sleepy lover back to her room.

The moment they laid down, her lover was quick to pull her arm around them so she was spooning them.

Natasha chuckled at their action, the love she has for Y/N only growing as she propped her elbow to stare at their sleeping face.

“I love you.” Y/N said quietly.

Natasha stilled for a bit before she tried her best to reply.

“Y/n, I—”

“Shh, it’s okay. I know.”

And with that, Y/N was fast asleep.

Natasha looked at her lover for a moment and she suddenly had an urge to cry, not because she was sad, but because the joy that came with the realization that Y/N knows she loves them is almost overwhelming.

She knows she still has a lot of work to do until she is able to say the words out loud, but for now, this is enough. Loving them through her own love language is enough.

She laid back down and pulled Y/N closer, planting a gentle kiss to the back of their neck. And this time she didn’t need to turn to know that there’s a smile that crept on her lover’s face.

“Я люблю тебя.” She whispered quietly as she too fell into a peaceful slumber.

Я люблю тебя - i love you.

reblog.comment:

Natasha smiled and looked back at the witch.

“He is Wanda. All of us are.”

The grin on the girl’s face was beautiful, and Natasha thinks that Vision is truly a lucky one.

“What about you?” The girl asked after a while. “What kept you up at night?”

“Couldn’t you just read my mind?” She teased.

Natasha knew she could’ve easily read her mind if she really wanted to, but after their first encounter, she knows that the little witch would never do it again unless she tells her to.

“I could, but where’s the fun in that?” The witch teased back and Natasha laughed.

“You’re not wrong there, little witch.”

“So? What’s up?”

Natasha didn’t answer her. She simply just stared down at her coffee mug, not knowing how to explain what’s bothering her.

“It’s about Y/N.” It was more of a statement than a question.

Natasha sighed and nodded her head, knowing there’s no use in lying to Wanda.

“Did something happened?” Wanda asked, suddenly concerned.

“No.”

“Then what is it?”

“I… I don’t know how to tell her I love her,” Natasha muttered out, a light blush flushed over her pale cheeks.

Wanda only smiled at her warmly, knowing full well how hard it is for the former assassin to love someone, let alone admit it out loud.

“Why are you so fixated on telling her you love her?” She asked the woman gently.

“We’ve been together since before Thanos happened, and I never once told her I love you. And I guess I just, I want something normal for once. I want to be able to tell her I love you. But those words just, never seem to be able to come out.”

Wanda placed a hand on Natasha’s shoulder, silently comforting the overthinking redhead. They stayed like that for a while until the sun started peaking through the window.

“We’re the Avengers, Nat. We strayed from normal long ago.” The witch said mindlessly.

Natasha sighed, because she knows that. She knows they’ve lost the chance to be normal long ago, especially Wanda and herself. But that doesn’t mean she doesn’t wish for it.

“Sometimes,” she spoke gently, “nothing needs to be said in order for someone to understand it. Vision’s not quite human, so he never really knows how to feel. But I know he loves me. I can feel it when he always makes time for me. When he always knows when to give me space and when to keep me company. He’s always there to make sure that I never feel alone, and although he never said I love you, I know he does.”

“And it doesn’t upset you? That he never said it?”

The girl only smiled as she turned and stare down the hallway.

“It used to. But, I love him. So I’m willing to learn how to speak his love language when he isn’t able to speak mine.”

Natasha looked over at the witch and smiled softly, she understands what Wanda was trying to tell her and she’s grateful for it.

“Thank you.” She said as she turned to pull Wanda into a hug.

The girl smiled and returned the embrace, knowing that the redhead had gotten her message.

As Wanda got up and left, Natasha called out for her before she reached the hallway.

“Hey, Wanda?” She called out.

The witch hummed in reply as she turned slightly to look at the redhead.

Natasha was thoughtful for a moment before she decided to just keep her words casual and not sentimental.

“It’s nothing, just… glad you’re here is all.”

The witch smiled widely and replied warmly.

“I love you, too.”

Natasha only laughed as she shook her head, Wanda really is something else.

It was about an hour later when Y/N strolled in the kitchen, looking adorably sleepy as they walked up to Natasha and wrapped their arms around her neck.

“You weren’t in bed.” Y/N said through a pout.

Natasha let out a soft giggle as she planted a kiss on her lover’s head.

“Sorry love, I couldn’t sleep.”

“Is everything alright?”

The worried look in Y/N’s eyes filled Natasha’s heart with fondness and warmth that she’s never thought that she’d be able to feel.

“Everything’s great love, promise.”

“Then come back to bed with me” Her lover whined and Natasha simply shook her head, the smile still on her face.

She left a kiss on Y/N’s cheek and laced their fingers together, pulling her sleepy lover back to her room.

The moment they laid down, her lover was quick to pull her arm around them so she was spooning them.

Natasha chuckled at their action, the love she has for Y/N only growing as she propped her elbow to stare at their sleeping face.

“I love you.” Y/N said quietly.

Natasha stilled for a bit before she tried her best to reply.

“Y/n, I—”

“Shh, it’s okay. I know.”

And with that, Y/N was fast asleep.

Natasha looked at her lover for a moment and she suddenly had an urge to cry, not because she was sad, but because the joy that came with the realization that Y/N knows she loves them is almost overwhelming.

She knows she still has a lot of work to do until she is able to say the words out loud, but for now, this is enough. Loving them through her own love language is enough.

She laid back down and pulled Y/N closer, planting a gentle kiss to the back of their neck. And this time she didn’t need to turn to know that there’s a smile that crept on her lover’s face.

“Я люблю тебя.” She whispered quietly as she too fell into a peaceful slumber.

Я люблю тебя - i love you.

summary: I feel like I haven't seen enough discussion about the fact that Tony Stark actually named his child after his wife's weird...
body:
I feel like I haven’t seen enough discussion about the fact that Tony Stark actually named his child after his wife’s weird uncle because that one time he had a dream that he named his child after his wife’s weird uncle.

Additionally, Pepper Potts knew that was the reason and went along with it.

summary: Marvel fan claims to have seen 'Avengers: Endgame' 110 times
title: Marvel fan claims to have seen 'Avengers: Endgame' 110 times
body:
There’s no getting around the fact that Avengers: Endgame was a big draw.

Even some casual fans of the Marvel Cinematic Universe caught it more than once in order to better take in its sturdy three-hour plus runtime.

But for some, going to see the climax of the MCU’s 22 movie story arc has become a way of life.

Read more: Endgame almost featured first MCU f-bomb

One fan – Agustin Alanis from Mexico – is claiming he’s been to see the movie a truly devoted/baffling 110 times.

Round/View 110

They are SHIELD…Well, actually Hydra. But, we didn’t know that yet.#avengersendgame #TigreVengador @RobertDowneyJr @ChrisEvans @Russo_Brothers @Avengers @jimmyfallon pic.twitter.com/wYzak4gnGR

— Agustin Alanis (@agalanis17) June 11, 2019

More staggering still is that he says he hit the record in just under a month, with his 103rd screening being taken in with fellow Marvel fan Tony Mitchell, aka ‘Nem: The Infinity Watcher’.

This beats what was regarded as the previous record, when Marvel buff Mitchell from Charlotte, North Carolina went to see the movie’s predecessor Avengers: Infinity War 103 times in 2018, bagging himself a Guinness World Record.

Round/View 103

Today I tie this legend @NemRaps with 103 views watching the same film in theaters. You sparked this to be done, so I honor you brother.#avengersendgame @Avengers @ChrisEvans @Russo_Brothers @Kevfeige @RobertDowneyJr #tigrevengador @louisde2 #Avengers https://t.co/VVBVlhR53b pic.twitter.com/OFJYeRrTk5

— Agustin Alanis (@agalanis17) June 9, 2019

Plus it means that he’s spent nearly 314 hours watching the movie, around 13 days in all.

Director Joe Russo even congratulated Mitchell personally for his dedication at the time, and invited him to the Endgame set to watch reshoots, so presumably Alanis will be taking over as Captain America or something.

Alanis appears to be a die-hard Marvel fan of all stripes, though, not just for the Avengers.

Read more: Dark Phoenix could lose £98 million

As well as shots with the likes of Chris Evans and Paul Rudd, his Instagram is littered with pictures of him meeting the likes of Jessica Jones star Krysten Ritter and British X-Men star Michael Fassbender.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Agustin Alanis (@agalanis17) on Oct 17, 2018 at 5:39pm PDT

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Agustin Alanis (@agalanis17) on Jan 15, 2019 at 4:27pm PST

And not to mention the late Stan Lee. He’d have been proud.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Agustin Alanis (@agalanis17) on Nov 12, 2018 at 11:24am PST

summary: As much as I am a huge Steggy fan, the script missed out on including Bucky in more of the dialogue.  How hard would’ve been for...
body:
As much as I am a huge Steggy fan, the script missed out on including Bucky in more of the dialogue. 

How hard would’ve been for Steve to say in the support group scene: I went into the ice in ‘45 right after I lost the love of my life. Woke up 70 years later and found my best friend again before losing him to Thanos…..You gotta move on. Gotta move on. The world is in our hands. What’s left is us, guys. You gotta do something with it. Or Thanos should’ve killed all of us.

I feel some kind of dialogue like this would’ve deepened his choice about why he goes back to Peggy by acknowledging that the Bucky Steve knows and remembers from The First Avenger is simply different than the Bucky who came out of the ice and started to heal in Wakanda.

Also, couldn’t Bucky have said when they depart: I’m gonna miss you, buddy…but I understand. And I’m gonna be okay. I hope. Leave it just ambiguous enough for us to understand more that they talked about Steve leaving and Bucky chose to stay in the present because he’s more comfortable “in the future”. I don’t know, maybe it’s just me.

title: Are you telling me Steve stayed back in time to be with Peggy, but didn’t do shit to save Bucky? Are you sure MCU, are you fuckin’ SURE?!
